title: Kerning feedback on word mark
content:
Hi All,  
Just wanted to get some feedback on the problem areas (kerning-wise) on this word mark that I'm in process on for a client. (Created by heavily modifying Carisma Light ( [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/castletype/carisma/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140720185944/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/castletype/carisma/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/castletype/carisma/") in case anyone was curious) Any thoughts are appreciated guys, thank you,  
m

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140720185944im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Truffle_Wordmark_02_4669.jpg)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140720185944im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Truffle_Wordmark_5417.jpg)
author: michaelwasiak

comments.content:
First:  
- The "U" is very unhappy.  
- The leg of the "R" appears to be getting thicker as it goes out, looking unpleasant.  
- That diamond thing is cool, but too strong - I'd make it smaller and/or thinner.

hhp

Hrant,  
Thanks for the feedback...Yeah I'm struggling with the U :( Any specific ideas on how to improve the letterform? When you say "thicker as it goes out" is it possible to provide a bit more details? Thanks, I appreciate you taking the time to comment.  
m

"U": I'd have to do it myself, for a fee. You're probably better off doing it yourself, maybe by looking at existing similar designs.

"R": The part where it curls looks thicker than the the part that joins the bowl. Easy enough to fix.

hhp

The T is almost dropping of the shelf… The F twins should be every so slightly closer to each other (as twins usually are).  
The bowl of the U could be smoother where it connects to the verticals. The J overshoots — maybe a rendering issue.

Minor problems, easily solved. (BTW: check your designs by holding the print upside down, scrutinize it in a mirror. This really helps you notice stuff.)
